snippet: After shelving it midway through its third season, NBC is giving the comedy “Community” — and its passionate fans — another semester after “30 Rock” fared even worse in its Thursday time slot.
abstract: NBC sitcom Community, which was shelved by the network midway through its third season, is returning to the air; network decided to give the show, and its fans, another chance after episodes began appearing on Hulu, gaining new viewers and reinforcing Community's role as one of the first shows of the so-called post-television era.
lead_paragraph: After shelving it midway through its third season, NBC is giving the comedy “Community” — and its passionate fans — another semester after “30 Rock” fared even worse in its Thursday time slot.

headline.seo: NBC Brings ‘Community’ Back to Its Passionate Fan Base
